Description: TO PROVIDE VENEZUELAN REFUGEES AND DISPLACED PERSONS WITH FOOD AND CLOTHING, COORDINATE MEDICAL AND DENTAL CARE, CONNECT THEM WITH PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYERS.
TO FUND OUTREACH HEALTH FAIRS THAT OFFER TESTING AND SCREENING SERVICES TO UNREGISTERED VENEZUELAN REFUGEES.
GRANTEE WILL USE FUNDS TO PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FOR MIGRANT CHILDREN.
GRANT WILL BE USED BY GRANTEE TO PURCHASE A 4X4 PICKUP TRUCK, WHICH WILL BE USED TO TRANSPORT GOODS AND SERVICES TO AND FROM A SHELTER FOR MIGRANTS.
GRANT WILL BE USED BY GRANTEE TO PURCHASE AND REMODEL A USED BUS TO FUNCTION AS A MOBILE SCHOOL, FOCUSING ESPECIALLY ON REFUGEE CHILDREN.
TO STRENGTHEN THE PROTECTION NETWORK AND ASSOCIATED SERVICES AND FACILITATE THE SELF-RELIANCE AND INTEGRATION OF VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS AND REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS.
SUPPORT THE DURABLE INTEGRATION OF VULNERABLE VENEZUELANS AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN COLOMBIA BY ENABLING ACCESS TO PROTECTION, HEALTHCARE, AND SOCIOECONOMIC INCLUSION.
STRENGTHEN THE PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE RESPONSE FOR SOCIAL INTEGRATION AND SELF-RELIANCE OF VULNERABLE VRMS IN HOST COMMUNITIES.
SUPPORT THE SOCIOECONOMIC INTEGRATION OF VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS AND REFUGEES IN BRAZIL THROUGH ACCESS TO PROTECTION, WASH SOLUTIONS, AND SUSTAINABLE LIVELIHOOD OPPORTUNITIES.

TO ASSIST THE SECTORS UNDER THE GIFMM AND THE NGO FORUM WITH ACCURATE, RELEVANT, AND TIMELY INFORMATION FOR MONITORING HUMANITARIAN SITUATION AND RESPONSE RELATED TO THE VENEZUELAN MIGRANT AND REFUGEE SITUATION IN COLOMBIA

STRENGTHEN THE CAPACITY OF GOVERNMENT AUTHORITIES AND LOCAL CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATIONS TO MITIGATE AND ADDRESS THE IMPACTS OF COVID-19 ON ASYLUM SEEKERS, REFUGEES, AND VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN COSTA RICA.
IMPROVE SAFETY AND WELL-BEING OF REFUGEES, ASYLUM SEEKERS, VULNERABLE MIGRANTS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS BY IMPROVING ACCESS TO PROTECTION, ASSISTANCE AND SUSTAINABLE SOLUTIONS IN JUTIAPA AND CHIQUIMULA
PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE PROTECTION TO CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES ON THE MOVE IN SOUTHERN MEXICO
REFUGEES, ASYLUM SEEKERS, AND VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN MEXICO MEET THEIR MOST URGENT NEEDS AND INCREASE THEIR OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTERIM AND DURABLE SOLUTIONS.
PROVIDE LIFE SAVING HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE AND PROTECTION TO ASYLUM SEEKERS, REFUGEES, AND VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN PANAMA.

PROVIDING DISPLACED POPULATIONS WITH QUALITY SERVICES AND EMPOWERMENT TOOLS TO REBUILD THEIR LIVES IN SAFETY AND DIGNITY, GUARANTEE THE ENJOYMENT OF HUMAN RIGHTS AND PROMOTE THEIR INTEGRATION PROCESSES IN COSTA RICA.
VULNERABLE VENEZUELAN REFUGEES, ASYLUM SEEKERS, MIGRANTS AND HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN COLOMBIA LIVE WITH DIGNITY.
VULNERABLE VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS, REFUGEES AND HOST COMMUNITY MEMBERS LIVE DIGNIFIED LIVES
PROMOTE SOCIOECONOMIC AND CULTURAL INTEGRATION OF VULNERABLE MIGRANTS, RETURNEES, AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN COLOMBIA
TO SUPPORT THE AVAILABILITY OF AND ACCESS TO TIMELY AND RELEVANT HEALTH CARE SERVICES FOR VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS AND REFUGEES, AS WELL AS HOST COMMUNITIES.
SUPPORT THE LOCAL INTEGRATION OF VULNERABLE VENEZUELANS IN GUYANA AND TRINIDAD AND TOBAGO THROUGH PROTECTION, EDUCATION, AND LIVELIHOODS PROGRAMMING.
TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROTECTION AND SOCIAL INTEGRATION OF MIGRANTS, REFUGEES, AND HOST POPULATIONS THROUGH LEGAL ASSISTANCE, PSYCHOSOCIAL SUPPORT, IMPROVED ACCESS TO HEALTH SYSTEMS, AND SHELTER.
:  VULNERABLE VENEZUELANS LIVING ON THE STREETS, IN RENTALS AND IN INFORMAL SETTLEMENTS IN RORAIMA STATE, BRAZIL ARE ABLE TO LIVE WITH DIGNITY.
TO REDUCE PREVENTABLE MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY DUE TO COVID 19 AMONG VULNERABLE REFUGEES, MIGRANTS AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN COLOMBIA.
STRENGTHEN THE PROTECTION AND ASSISTANCE RESPONSE TO VULNERABLE VRMS IN HOST COMMUNITIES
VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS, COLOMBIAN RETURNEES AND HOST COMMUNITY GIRLS AND BOYS RECEIVE AN INTEGRATED PACKAGE OF CHILD CENTERED PROTECTION, HEALTH AND LIVELIHOODS SERVICES
RESPOND TO CRITICAL PROTECTION NEEDS OF VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN TRANSIT, AFFECTED BY THE VENEZUELAN MIGRATION CRISIS USING ELECTRONIC VALUE AND COMMODITY VOUCHER ASSISTANCE

TO ENHANCE CHILD PROTECTION AND SHELTER CONDITIONS FOR VULNERABLE VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS, CHILDREN AT RISK, PARTICULARLY UNACCOMPANIED AND SEPARATED CHILDREN (UASC), AND CAREGIVERS THROUGH THE CAMINANTES ROUTES

GUARANTEE THE RIGHTS OF VENEZUELAN REFUGEES AND MIGRANTS LIVING IN BRAZIL IN SUPPORT OF THE HUMANITARIAN EMERGENCY PROGRAM OPERACAO ACOLHIDA OA LED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF BRAZIL IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE UN SYSTEM

PROVIDE LIFE-CHANGING LIVELIHOOD AND PROTECTION ASSISTANCE TO VENEZUELAN MIGRANTS AND REFUGEES LIVING IN BRAZIL.
TO CONTRIBUTE TO FULFILLING FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS, PROTECTION SCENARIOS, AND LOCAL INTEGRATION OF REFUGEE, MIGRANT, ASYLUM-SEEKERS, AND HOST COMMUNITIES IN COLOMBIA.
STRENGTHEN LOCAL CAPACITY TO PROTECT AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO VULNERABLE VENEZUELAN  REFUGEES AND MIGRANTS  IN ARUBA AND CURACAO

SUPPORT SAFE MIGRATION FOR VENEZUELAN CAMINANTES AS WELL AS ASENTADOS AND VULNERABLE COLOMBIANS ACROSS UNDERSERVED AREAS IN THE DEPARTMENTS OF ARAUCA AND CASANARE THROUGH IMPROVED PROTECTION AND WASH SERVICES.

ADVANCE THE FUTURE OF VENEZUELAN REFUGEES AND COLOMBIANS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMMING THAT INCREASES ACCESS TO CRITICAL LEGAL, PROTECTION, HEALTH AND PSYCHOSOCIAL SERVICES, AS WELL AS LIVELIHOODS AND FINANCIAL INCLUSION OPPORTUNITIES.

TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO PROTECTION MECHANISMS, SHELTER SOLUTIONS AND HUMANITARIAN ASSISTANCE FOR VENEZUELAN AND COLOMBIAN POPULATION IN NEED OF INTERNATIONAL PROTECTION (PNIP), REFUGEES AND VULNERABLE MIGRANTS IN ECUADOR
